info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 08 at 10:02PM PST until December 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 10 PM PST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 14 to 22 inches. Wind gusting as high as 45 mph, which could cause reduced visibility due to blowing snow. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County, including all areas along I-5 and highway 89, as well as Mt. Shasta City, Dunsmuir, and McCloud. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds might bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Heavy snow rates are expected Friday night. In combination with the high snowfall rates, there is a 90% chance that winds cause blizzard like conditions with visibility below 0.5 miles near Weed (including I-5) and possibly as far south as Mt. Shasta City. The timing for these blizzard like conditions would be around 9 PM - 1 AM PST Friday night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
